hero.title: Know what runs before you switch
hero.subtitle: WinuxDB maps Windows app compatibility across Linux. Search, filter, and compare ratings so you can migrate with confidence.

Login.title: Welcome

Login.terms: By continuing, you agree to our <terms>Terms of Use</terms> and <privacy>Privacy Policy</privacy>.

Metadata.description: WinuxDB is the definitive Linux compatibility database for Windows applications. Search thousands of apps, check Wine and Proton ratings, and find the best Linux distro for your workflow.

DistroTaglines.ubuntu: Stable, polished, and backed by a massive community.
DistroTaglines.linux-mint: Comfortable, classic, and welcoming for Windows converts.
DistroTaglines.fedora: Fast, modern, and upstream-first with new features early.
DistroTaglines.popos: Ubuntu-based and productivity-focused, with strong hardware support.
DistroTaglines.arch: Minimal base, total control, rolling release.
DistroTaglines.endeavouros: Arch power with an easier installer and community focus.
DistroTaglines.bazzite: SteamOS-like gaming on Fedora Atomic, ready out of the box.
DistroTaglines.nobara: Fedora tuned for gaming, streaming, and creators.
DistroTaglines.zorin: Polished, Windows-like experience with friendly defaults.
DistroTaglines.pikaos: Ubuntu-based gaming distro tuned for low latency.
DistroTaglines.opensuse: The choice for sysadmins and developers with unique configuration tools.
DistroTaglines.nixos: Declarative, reproducible, and unbreakable system configuration.
DistroTaglines.manjaro: Accessible Arch-based distro with a focus on user-friendliness.

Privacy.title: Privacy Policy
Privacy.intro: WinuxDB is a community-driven project dedicated to mapping Windows application compatibility on Linux. We value transparency and your privacy.

data.title: 1. Data Collection
data.content: WinuxDB does not require registration and does not collect personal identifiers such as names, email addresses, or IP addresses. We are a search and reference tool, not a data-harvesting platform.

cookies.title: 2. Local Storage & Preferences
cookies.content: We use your browser's local storage or minimal cookies solely to remember your language preference and UI settings. This data never leaves your device.

links.title: 3. External Links
links.content: Our database contains links to external websites (e.g., WineHQ, GitHub, official software sites). We are not responsible for the privacy practices or content of these third-party services.

Terms.title: Terms of Use
Terms.intro: By using WinuxDB, you agree to the following terms. This project is created by the community, for the community, and is intended for informational purposes only.

noWarranty.title: 1. No Warranty
noWarranty.content: Information on WinuxDB is provided on an 'as-is' and 'as-available' basis. Compatibility ratings are based on community reports and may not reflect your specific hardware or software configuration. We do not guarantee that any application will run perfectly or at all.

liability.title: 2. Limitation of Liability
liability.content: WinuxDB, its contributors, and maintainers are not liable for any system instability, data loss, hardware damage, or financial loss resulting from the use of information found on this site. You use Wine, Proton, and other compatibility layers at your own risk.

affiliation.title: 3. No Affiliation
affiliation.content: WinuxDB is an independent community project. We are not affiliated with, endorsed by, or sponsored by Microsoft Corporation, WineHQ, CodeWeavers, Valve Corporation (Proton), ProtonDB, AWACY (Are We Anti-Cheat Yet?), or any software author listed in our database.

About.title: About WinuxDB
About.subtitle: Bridging the gap between Windows and Linux

mission.title: Our Mission
mission.content: WinuxDB was born from a simple observation: the biggest hurdle for most users switching to Linux isn't the interface or the terminal—it's the fear of losing their essential applications. We aim to eliminate 'compatibility anxiety' by providing clear, community-verified data on what runs, what doesn't, and how to get the most out of Wine compatibility layers.

history.title: Community-First
history.content: Inspired by the success of ProtonDB for gaming, WinuxDB focuses on the productivity, creative, and utility apps that power our daily lives. We are not a corporate entity; we are a group of enthusiasts building the resource we wish we had when we first switched.

Contribute.title: Contribute to WinuxDB
Contribute.subtitle: Help us build the ultimate compatibility index
Contribute.intro: WinuxDB is an open-source project. Every rating, bug report, and line of code is a gift to the Linux community.

reporting.title: 1. Report Compatibility
reporting.content: The most valuable way to contribute is by reporting how apps run on your system. You can submit reports directly via our GitHub repository by editing the src/lib/data/apps.jsonl file.

code.title: 2. Code & Design
code.content: Our codebase is built with Next.js and TypeScript. We welcome PRs for UI improvements, performance optimizations, and new features. Check our GitHub issues for 'good first issues'.

governance.title: 3. Governance
governance.content: WinuxDB follows a benevolent community model. Major architectural changes are discussed in GitHub Discussions, and all data updates require a peer-review process via Pull Requests to ensure accuracy.

AppDetail.noInstructions: No specific compatibility instructions available for this app yet.

wizard.title: Add New Device
wizard.methodTitle: How would you like to add your device?
wizard.methodDesc: Choose your preferred way to build your hardware profile.
wizard.methodSteamDesc: Fastest way. Copy and paste your Steam hardware report.
wizard.methodManualDesc: Type in your hardware details manually.
wizard.steamInputPlaceholder: Paste the text from Steam -> Help -> System Information here...
wizard.steamGuideStep1: Open Steam and click on 'Help' in the top menu.
wizard.steamGuideStep3: Wait for it to populate, then Right Click -> Copy all text to clipboard.
wizard.steamGuideStep4: Paste it in the field above.
wizard.parseError: Could not parse the hardware report. Please check the format or try manual entry.
wizard.manualDesc: Verify or enter your system details for accurate compatibility reporting.
wizard.finalizeDesc: Give your hardware profile a name to identify it easily.
wizard.deviceNamePlaceholder: e.g. Main Rig, ThinkPad, Steam Deck
